pullRequest.title: [559169] Fix Sirius preferences initialization
pullRequest.bodyText:
Initialize preferences in default scope instead of instance scope.
For MigrationCommandLine force Sirius preferences in the instance
scope

Bug: 559169
Change-Id: I81feb62961593847d6ca9ba2475e5a578b140f4a
Signed-off-by: Laurent Fasani laurent.fasani@obeo.fr

nodes.bodyText:
Is there a differences between accessing the preferences by using the preferenceStore like we here, compared to InstanceScope.INSTANCE.getNode(SiriusEditPlugin.ID); ?
Because for obtaining the preferences we do it in the first way, and for resetting them we do it another way. I suppose the result is the same, but this is kinda confusing.
I am talking about these preferences, see the comment below.

@lfasani If I understand correctly, we need to do this dirty hack, because we modify at runtime the default preferences, so we need to ensure that these changes are reflected in the command line default preferences.
What if instead we remove all of this code from here, and we put all the preferences in org.polarsys.capella.rcp\plugin_customization.ini, then we don't need to do this hack anymore right? The command line preferences will be automatically syncronized.

commit.message:
[559169] Fix Sirius preferences initialization

* Initialize preferences in default scope instead of instance scope.
* For MigrationCommandLine force Sirius preferences in the instance
scope

Bug: 559169
Change-Id: I81feb62961593847d6ca9ba2475e5a578b140f4a
Signed-off-by: Laurent Fasani <laurent.fasani@obeo.fr>
